Le Seigneur des anneaux est un roman de fantasy epique ecrit par J.R.R. Tolkien. L'histoire suit un hobbit nomme Frodon Sacquet alors qu'il entreprend une quÃªte pour dÃ©truire l'Anneau unique.

Les MisÃ©rables est un roman historique et social Ã©crit par Victor Hugo. L'histoire suit la vie de plusieurs personnages, y compris Jean Valjean, un ancien bagnard, et Javert, un policier qui le poursuit.

To Kill a Mockingbird is a novel by Harper Lee, set in the 1930s in a fictional town in Alabama. The story follows a young girl named Scout Finch and her family, as her father, a lawyer, defends a black man accused of rape.
The Great Gatsby is a novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald, set in the 1920s in New York. The story follows the wealthy Jay Gatsby and his obsession with his former love, Daisy Buchanan.
Brave New World is a dystopian novel by Aldous Huxley, set in a future society where people are genetically engineered and conditioned to be content with their assigned roles in life.

The Catcher in the Rye is a novel by J.D. Salinger, set in the 1950s in New York. The story follows Holden Caulfield, a teenager who is expelled from his prep school and goes on a journey of self-discovery.

The Lord of the Flies is a novel by William Golding, set on an uninhabited island after a group of British schoolboys are stranded there. The story explores the breakdown of societal norms and the boys' descent into savagery.
